revised_title: Chemical Composition of Calculi and the Tendency to Calculous Diseases
tldr: The author presents an analysis of 663 calculi from the Norfolk and Norwich Hospital, focusing on the chemical composition and the tendency of calculous diseases. The study reveals that lithic acid and lithate of ammonia are the most common components, with silica found in only one specimen. The author also discusses the prevalence of calculous diseases in different regions of Scotland and England.
